settings.text1: The effectiveness of IPL hair removal is based on the ratio between melanin in the skin and hair. It is recommended for dark hair and lighter skin tones, in order for the treatment to be effective and safe.

IPL (Intense Pulsed Light) is a hair removal method that targets the melanin inside hair follicles, utilizing a powerful and safe spectrum of light. This results in visible hair reduction without damaging the skin.

settings.text2: *Average UK hair removal expense, according to NHS report

settings.title: Trusted by over 7 million users worldwide.

settings.content:
Keep your skin flawless and say goodbye to last-minute hair removal hassles. With the Ulike Air+ delivering 19.8J of powerful energy, you can achieve visible, salon-quality results with just 4 weeks* of use.

* Refers to a decrease in hair density within 4 weeks, based on third-party lab testing. Individual results may vary.

settings.title: Can everyone use IPL?
settings.answer:
IPL (Intense Pulsed Light) hair removal works by emitting intense light pulses that are absorbed by the pigment in the hair follicles. The absorbed light is then converted into heat, which targets the hair follicles and inhibits future hair growth.

It is important to note that IPL is most effective on individuals with lighter skin tones and darker hair colours. This is because the light energy is primarily absorbed by the melanin pigment in the hair. In individual's skin that's rich in melanin, the excess melanin can also absorb the light energy, leading to potential skin damage.

Similarly, IPL may not be as effective on individuals with light hair colours such as blonde, gray, or red. This is because these hair colours have less melanin content, making it challenging for the IPL device to target the hair follicles effectively.

To ensure the effectiveness and safety of IPL hair removal, we recommend users to refer to the provided skin tone chart before making a purchase.

settings.title: Who should not use IPL?
settings.answer:
IPL hair removal device is not recommended if you have any of the following:

- A known skin disorder

- Skin diseases such as allergic dermatitis, eczema, etc.

- Photosensitive epilepsy or Photosensitivity

- Are menstruating, pregnant, or lactating

- Dark black or Sunburnt skin (please refer to the skin tone chart)

- Broken skin, a scab or healed wound, cancer or hemangioma

- Any artificial aesthetic, prosthetic, or plastic area

- Tattoo area

settings.title: Why choose IPL technology for hair removal?
settings.answer: IPL, or intense pulsed light, uses strong pulses of broad-spectrum light to target hair at the root. The light is absorbed by the melanin in the hair follicle, where it is then converted into heat, resulting in thinner regrowth and eventually stopping hair growth altogether. Ulike IPL devices are CE/UKCA cleared and offer a cost-effective, convenient solution compared to clinic laser and traditional methods of hair removal.

settings.title: How often should I use this product?
settings.answer:
We recommend using the device three times a week for the first month to achieve the best results. After that, you can use it once every two weeks or once a month for touch-ups as needed.

Furthermore, we advise tailoring your usage according to your hair growth. If you encounter areas with thicker hair or stubbornness, feel free to elevate the gear level and frequency of usage. Always pay attention to your skin's response and adjust accordingly to ensure your comfort and avoid any discomfort or adverse effects.

settings.title: When can I see results, and are they long-lasting?
settings.answer: Most customers begin to notice significant hair reduction after 3-4 weeks. With 2-3 treatments per week, results become evident after approximately 12 weeks. After each session, hair tends to grow back much more sparsely and thinly, leading to long-lasting hair reduction over time. To maintain smooth skin, it's recommended to perform monthly touch-ups. Individual results and treatment frequency may vary.

settings.title: Does IPL hair remover hurt?
settings.answer: IPL hair removal is generally considered to be much less painful and nearly as effective as laser hair removal. Additionally, Ulike employs Sapphire Ice Cooling technology to ensure nearly painless sessions.

settings.title: Do I need to shave before using IPL?
settings.answer: Yes, we recommend that you shave the treatment area before using the device. Shaving the hair will help IPL effectively target the hair follicles.

settings.title: Can I use the device on all parts of my body?
settings.answer: Yes, you can use Ulike IPL devices on almost every part of your body. However, please avoid using it directly on your genitals, eyes, tattooed areas or parts of the skin with open wounds. To ensure your comfort, we recommend treating sensitive areas such as the bikini area, inner thighs, and buttocks with the lowest power level.

settings.content:
*Claims and statistics on this page, including but not limited to maximum energy value, flashing frequency, and sapphire temperature during continuous use (if mentioned), are derived from Ulike's internal data or third-party reports under specific test environments.

**Hair reduction results and time for full or part body lighting (if mentioned) on this page are tested by third-party laboratory and individual results of both may vary. Specifically, hair reduction results may vary for different body area, different using durations and different measured parameters.

***The period of soft or smooth skin (if mentioned) on this page is subject to follow the recommended regime and individual results may vary.

****Any mention of "The world’s No.1 hair removal device brand in 2023" refer to the source: Frost& Sullivan, confirmed based on research on global hair removal device market and calculated by 2023 global sales volume metrics. Hair removal device refers to a beauty instrument that targets hair follicles using technologies such as lasers and intense pulsed light (IPL), with the aim of reducing or removing hair. Common types include IPL devices and laser hair removal devices. The survey was completed in October 2024.

*****Any mention fo SHR refer to a mode by harvesting heat accumulation by multiple IPL pulses for better hair removal results and a more comfortable experience.
